invoices.filter-input: Filter by seller or reference number ...

invoiceTypes.partialInvoice-description: A partial invoice is a standard invoice that covers one or more completed service items. This is common for long-term projects or staggered deliveries of goods. Unlike a progress payment invoice, which is independent of actual services provided, a partial invoice only includes charges for services that have been performed, along with associated warranty obligations.
invoiceTypes.commercialInvoice-description: This type represents the 'standard' goods or trade invoice and is the most commonly used type of invoice.
invoiceTypes.creditNote-description: A credit note is legally considered an invoice that, unlike a standard invoice, is issued by the recipient of the service. It should not be confused with an invoice correction, which is often informally referred to as a credit note.
invoiceTypes.correctedInvoice-description: A corrected invoice (also called a cancellation invoice) is issued when an original invoice contains errors or when the service was not fully or properly delivered, requiring a reduction in the invoice amount. A corrected invoice must always reference an existing invoice.
invoiceTypes.selfBilledInvoice-description: A self-billed invoice is issued by the customer. The supplier receives a copy of the invoice and the payment from the customer.
invoiceTypes.partialConstructionInvoice-description: A partial invoice for construction work. A partial invoice does not have the same legal binding effect as a final invoice.
invoiceTypes.partialFinalConstructionInvoice-descript: A partial final invoice has the same status as a final invoice. It is used to invoice work that has been accepted as part of a partial completion process.
invoiceTypes.finalConstructionInvoice-description: The basis for a final invoice is the completion and acceptance of the agreed services, including any additional claims.
invoiceTypes.unknown-description: The invoice type is not recognized by the system.
